Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir,

Certainly, Your Excellency, Colonel Lebério, must be prepared to receive your orders, and it has come to my attention that the government may take action; therefore, I await from Your Excellency Your Excellency Your Excellency.

I had written to you from São Gabriel regarding a similar matter, a letter which is now in the possession of the wife of compadre José Mariano, and were it not for the reasons that occurred, certainly I would not have taken such a step without Your Excellency's deliberation.

The health of Your Excellency,

From Your Excellency’s very grateful friend, Antônio José de Abreu

Nota Bene Your Excellency

Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir Domingos José de Almeida. Alegrete.

Received and replied to on August 28, 1840.
